Recommended By Curators

"One of the stranger tower defense games I've ever played. Tries to do a zen thing & makes you attack oppression & bullying. I don't get it but it's fun."

About This Game


Try, try one more time. Life is full obstacles, overcome them! Destroy negativity, clear your mind! Particula brings you a new perspective in gaming, helping you to concentrate, and to clear your mind. Live, live like it was your last day.

  • 3 Players Co-op tower defense. Play it with your friends!
  • Freeze, burn and purify
  • Random enemies, Waves and Bosses
  • Smooth soundtrack
  • Single-player
  • Multi-player
  • Steam Trading Cards
READ MORE

System Requirements

Windows
Mac OS X
    Minimum:
    • OS: Windows 7/8/8.1
    • Processor: 2.0 GHz
    • Memory: 2 GB RAM
    • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GT 240 (or better)
    • Network: Broadband Internet connection
    • Hard Drive: 1 GB available space
    Minimum:
    • OS: 10.9
    • Processor: 2.5 GHz
    • Memory: 2 GB RAM
    • Graphics: Intel HD Graphics 4000 (or better)
    • Network: Broadband Internet connection
    • Hard Drive: 1 GB available space

38 of 45 people (84%) found this review helpful
2

1 person found this review funny
Nexiu
208 products in account
149 reviews
Not Recommended
3.7 hrs on record
Posted: August 17
Okay, let me start with the fact that I got this game for free. So I played it with a friend for a few hours and then found that it was terribly boring. You will be able to see the entire contents of the game after just a few rounds. Gameplay is the same throughout the entire game. 3 types of towers with a 3 levels, each of them differs only in arena of effect/damage/atack speed. Of course, you may upgrade them. I've had more fun with free flash tower defense games online. The best part of this game is its smooth soundtrack. Additionally, there are a bunch of Steam Trading Cards to earn in the game. Also, I am sorry to tell you not to buy this game. It really should be free.

Not Recommended
1.9 hrs on record
Posted: September 7
Pro:
  • Looks nice.
  • Sounds nice.
Con:
  • Only 3 maps.
  • Only 3 towers.
  • Only 2 enemies.
  • Only 1 strategy.
Conclusion
I have played over 40 Tower Defense games. This is the very worst one, beating even Fort Defense. The average free mobile TD has more depth.

Zemy6
181 products in account
3 reviews
Not Recommended
0.6 hrs on record
Posted: August 25
"Negativity achieved!" Is what I guess this game's losing screen is, I wouldn't actually know as it's so easy and repetitive i won the first game then stopped.

-First of all the camera is bad but it is a good idea to not have a fixed camera.

-Next why in the name of the lord would you not have a next wave button 0.2 of my 0.3 hours of this game was waiting for the next wave.

-Lastly why would you make a multiplayer tower defense and let others sell your towers?

Lots of love
-Zemy X

P.S make your menus easier to navigate and have it so when i click off of a tower i don't have that tower selected.

P.P.S please spend more then 20p on your game and get an upgrade to your wooden computer that can only run the most basic of game making software (like seriously did you make this on scratch?)

P.P.P.S the only reason I said 0.3 above and i have 0.6 is because I acidently left the game open but doing so made me feel diffently about the world i feel like this game can make a difference. For those 30 extra minutes it taught me something, always appreciate the small things in life because someday they may just dissapear.

P.P.P.P.S The only reason it was running in the background was because there was no exit button and i forgot i needed to close it manually.

Was this review helpful? Yes No Funny

Vampyro
612 products in account
5 reviews
Not Recommended
0.6 hrs on record
Posted: June 8
This is not a good game, not even close. It's average at best and poor at worse. There are only 3 types of tower and only 3 levels of tower, hell, thats about how many levels the game actually has. The graphics are pretty basic and the music is very generic, the biggest problem is it does not stand up against any other tower defence at all, it might be good for beginners who are learning how to play tower defence. The thing that stood out to me the most is the fact that you need to delete your level 1 towers to place level 2 towers and so on. It seems counter productive. Overall, if you are looking for tower defence, go and play Defence Grid.
